page.title: 04WEST NEWTON: Life-style
page.content:
{Comunications:}Most houses have a telephone. There is a public phone and a post box.
{Transport:}There is no bus service. Children must walk to the Ellerby to Sproatley road for the school bus. The younger ones attend Sproatley School, the older ones the South Holderness Comprehensive School at Preston. Most residents drive their own vehicles.
Its peace makes it attractive, and its inhabitants hope no{development}will turn it into a built-up area like the nearby ex-village of Sproatley. Peace is sometimes shattered however, by low flying{military}aircraft.
Deciduous woods (The Moors) relieve the monotony of prairie-like fields and are home to many{pheasants.
